recipes.title: How to Make Fresh Pasta
recipes.description: In Emilia-Romagna, the region in Italy where fresh pasta rules, the dough is classically made with soft wheat flour and whole fresh eggs. Purists in the province prefer pasta doughs that have been rolled out on a wooden board to those rolled out with a machine, saying that sauce clings much better to the hand-rolled variety.

recipes.title: How to Cook Pasta

recipes.title: Ravioli with Herbed Ricotta Filling
recipes.description: You can shape the pasta and freeze it up to a month before cooking.

recipes.title: Classic Pasta Dough
recipes.description: Italians use soft wheat flour to make fresh pasta. We tested the recipe with soft wheat flour and all-purpose flour and tasted them side by side, and we much prefer the soft wheat version—it gives the pasta a silkier texture. Order Italian-style flour from www.kingarthurflour.com, or look for Italian 00 flour at gourmet or online stores. Use this dough to make Ravioli with Herbed Ricotta Filling (page 141).

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Calzones
recipes.description: Toss together a black bean salad to go with these family-friendly turnovers. Combine 1 (15-ounce) can rinsed and drained black beans, 1 cup quartered cherry tomatoes, 1/2 cup chopped red onion, 1/4 cup chopped celery, 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium bowl; toss well to coat.
recipes.servings_yield: 4 servings (serving size: 1 calzone and 1 tablespoon sour cream)

recipes.title: Speedy Cioppino
recipes.description: The bright taste of a lemon-dressed salad goes well with this seafood stew. Combine 1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and 1 minced garlic clove, stirring with a whisk. Combine 6 cups gourmet salad greens, 1 cup halved cherry tomatoes, and 1/2 cup slivered red onion. Drizzle dressing over salad; toss gently to coat.
recipes.servings_yield: 4 servings (serving size: about 1 1/4 cups stew and 10 mussels)

recipes.title: Fennel-Rubbed Pork with Shallot-Pomegranate Reduction
recipes.description: Serve with walnut couscous. Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add 1/2 cup chopped onion; sauté 3 minutes. Add 1 1/4 cups water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper; bring to a boil. Stir in 1 cup couscous. Remove from heat; cover and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Sprinkle with 3 tablespoons toasted chopped walnuts and 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley.
recipes.servings_yield: 4 servings (serving size: 3 ounces pork and about 2 tablespoons sauce)

ingredients.item: chilled butter, cut into small pieces

recipes.title: Fiesta Chicken Tacos with Mango and Jicama Salad
recipes.description: Try this with a side of chipotle refritos. Combine 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, 1 teaspoon minced canned chipotle chile in adobo sauce, 1 (16-ounce) can refried beans, and 1 minced garlic clove in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro.

ingredients.item: skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into thin strips

recipes.title: Spiced Pork Chops with Apple Chutney
recipes.description: Slender haricots verts are a pretty and quick-cooking complement to the meal. Heat 2 teaspoons olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 12 ounces haricots verts to pan; cook 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon black pepper, and 2 thinly sliced garlic cloves; cook 5 minutes or until garlic is lightly browned.
recipes.servings_yield: 4 servings (serving size: 1 chop and about 1/3 cup chutney)

ingredients.item: boneless center-cut pork loin chops, trimmed

recipes.title: Halibut with Coconut-Red Curry Sauce
recipes.description: A bed of seasoned rice with bok choy soaks up the sauce. Combine 2 2/3 cups water and 3/4 cup basmati rice in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 12 minutes. Stir in 2 cups chopped baby bok choy; cover and cook 8 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Combine 1 1/2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce, 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice, 1/2 teaspoon sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon dark sesame oil; stir into rice mixture.

recipes.title: Spicy Asian Noodles with Chicken
recipes.description: Add a snow pea sauté to complete the meal. Heat 2 teaspoons canola oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 minced garlic cloves; sauté 15 seconds. Add 2 cups trimmed snow peas and 1 cup drained sliced water chestnuts; sauté 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove from heat; stir in 1 tablespoon dark sesame oil.

ingredients.item: chopped roasted skinless, boneless chicken breasts

recipes.title: Pan-Grilled Thai Tuna Salad

recipes.title: Seared Scallops with Warm Tuscan Beans
recipes.description: Grilled garlic bread is great for dipping into the brothy beans. Heat a grill pan over medium heat. Brush 1 tablespoon olive oil evenly over 4 (1-ounce) slices French bread. Add bread to pan; cook 2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Rub one side of each bread slice with cut sides of a halved garlic clove.

The idea of small plates featuring the vibrant tastes of northern and western India is starting to take hold in this country.

recipes.title: Borlotti Minestrone
recipes.description: Borlotti beans—the Italian variety of cranberry beans—can be ordered from www.ranchogordo.com, among other online retailers. Why are time-honored varieties of beans finding fresh favor in home kitchens? 'I think heirloom beans taste better,' says Steve Sando, whose Rancho Gordo in Napa, California, grows and sells nearly 30 varieties of distinctive beans. 'Runner beans tend to be buttery. Christmas limas have a distinct chestnut taste, and the bean broth is beefy. Some types are like potatoes in texture; others are creamy.'

recipes.title: Spice-Rubbed Pork Tenderloin

If you don't have whole allspice berries, use ground.

recipes.title: Tomato-Poached Eggs with Sardinian Music Bread

Thin, crispy pane carasau is a staple in Sardinia but you can substitute crisp lavosh for a similar crunch. Chop whole peeled tomatoes in the can with kitchen shears for easy cleanup.

recipes.title: Yale College Punch
recipes.description: Retro cocktails get all the attention these days, but punch predates individual mixed drinks by at least two centuries, according to Punch: The Delights (and Dangers) of the Flowing Bowl ($24; Perigee). The book, by drinks historian David Wondrich, includes historically accurate recipes dating back as far as 1668. Some of the punches call for far-out ingredients like whale cholesterol, but this recipe from 1867 is much more doable for modern-day spirit lovers. It's the 19th-century version of that college favorite 'jungle juice.'

recipes.title: Cucumber Coleslaw
recipes.description: I created this cucumber coleslaw recipe so I could use a julienne peeler I received as a gift. I had leftover sparkling wine, so I thought I'd try to use it over julienned cucumbers to make this refreshing slaw. It's a nice way to round out a brunch or picnic.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup sparkling or dry white wine
2 cups fresh arugula or  baby spinach, coarsely chopped
1 cup fresh snow peas, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

recipes.title: Salmon Alfredo
recipes.description: Salmon Alfredo is a simple yet elegant dinner that’s perfect for cozy weeknight meals or when entertaining dinner guests. Flaky salmon, hot fettuccine and a perfectly smooth Alfredo sauce come together for an easy restaurant-quality meal at home.

ingredients.item: 2 salmon fillets (6 ounces each), skin removed

recipes.title: Beef Tenderloin Roast
recipes.description: This five-ingredient beef tenderloin roast is an elegant yet simple dish perfect for holiday gatherings or special family dinners. Add in your favorite herbs and spices to customize the flavor.

recipes.title: Pepper Steak
recipes.description: This delicious pepper steak recipe is perfect if you're on the hunt for a quick, nourishing, flavor-packed meal for your next weeknight dinner. Look no further!

ingredients.item: 1 pound beef top round steak, cut into 1/4x2-inch strips
2 medium green peppers, cut into strips
2 fresh tomatoes, peeled and cut into wedges

recipes.title: Chicken Fajitas
recipes.description: Sizzling chicken fajitas are super easy to make and full of flavor. The secret is in the skillet, which can go from stove to table for restaurant-quality presentation.

ingredients.item: 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, optional
1-1/2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into thin strips
Optional: Shredded cheddar cheese, taco sauce, salsa, guacamole, sliced red onions and sour cream

recipes.title: Flavorful Salmon Fillets
recipes.description: Compliments are a sure thing when I fix these fabulous salmon fillets. A tasty marinade pumps up the flavor and keeps them moist and tender.

ingredients.item: 2 salmon fillets (1 inch thick and 6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Cream of Asparagus Soup
recipes.description: We have a large asparagus patch and are able to freeze a lot for the year. My recipe highlights the flavor of the vegetable and is very easy to make.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces (about 5 cups)

recipes.title: Fruity Pork Roast
recipes.description: I like using the slow cooker for our meals because it gives me time for other preparations, frees the oven, and it usually doesn't matter if you serve it later than planned. The fruit in this recipe, which I adapted, gives the pork a special flavor.

ingredients.item: 3 tablespoons sherry or additional unsweetened apple juice

recipes.title: Garden Bounty Panzanella Salad
recipes.description: My sister gave me fresh tomatoes and basil, so I made a bread salad known as Panzanella. The longer it sits, the more the bread soaks up the seasonings.

ingredients.item: 12 ounces French or ciabatta bread, cut into 1-inch cubes (about 12 cups)
1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium sweet yellow pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 small red onion, halved and thinly sliced

recipes.title: Garlic Bean Dip
recipes.description: There isn't a bean that my family does not like. In fact, I serve one kind or another almost every day. This dip is one of our favorite ways to eat them.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
Baked pita chips or assorted fresh vegetables

recipes.title: Garlic-Grilled Chicken with Pesto Zucchini Ribbons
recipes.description: The first time I substituted zucchini noodles for regular pasta, it was because I was trying to reduce carbohydrates and calories. Now I make them because we love the flavor and texture they bring to dishes. This dish is just as delicious if you substitute shrimp for the chicken.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)
4 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, cut into 1/2-inch cubes

recipes.title: Grilled Steak
recipes.description: These perfectly grilled steaks are finished with a robust garlic mixture that releases an incredible aroma. Whether you're cooking with charcoal or gas, we'll show you how long to grill steak and provide some helpful tips along the way.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless beef strip steaks or ribeye steaks (1 inch thick and 8 ounces each)

recipes.title: Garlic-Mushroom Turkey Slices
recipes.description: My daughter is a picky eater, and even she likes this enticing dish! There’s minimal fat, and it’s delicious, easy and affordable for weeknight dining.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup dry white wine or additional broth

recipes.title: Ginger Honey Marinated Salmon
recipes.description: Ginger, garlic powder and green onion blend nicely for this marinated salmon. We've found it tastes even better when marinated in the fridge overnight. We also like to use this versatile mixture when grilling chicken!

ingredients.item: 1 salmon fillet (1-1/2 pounds and 3/4 inch thick)

recipes.title: Goat Cheese and Spinach Stuffed Chicken
recipes.description: This spinach-stuffed chicken breast recipe is special to me because it has so much flavor, yet not too many calories. I love Italian food, but most of the time it is too heavy. This is a healthy twist on an Italian dish!

ingredients.item: 1/3 cup julienned soft sun-dried tomatoes (not packed in oil), chopped
2 boneless skinless chicken breasts (6 ounces each)
Aged balsamic vinegar or balsamic glaze, optional

recipes.title: Green Beans Amandine
recipes.description: It's hard to improve on the taste of fresh green beans, but this recipe for green beans amandine does it. The final dish looks fancy without requiring fancy cooking skills.

ingredients.item: 1 pound fresh or frozen green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

recipes.title: Greens and Beans Turkey Soup
recipes.description: On winter evenings, we like nothing better than a piping hot bowl of soup. This one uses the turkey carcass to make a flavorful stock for the soup.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) great northern beans, rinsed and drained
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipes.title: Grilled Mahi Mahi
recipes.description: Instead of grilling the usual hamburgers or chicken breasts, prepare this grilled mahi mahi and reel in raves!

recipes.title: Grilled Teriyaki Chicken
recipes.description: Our grilled teriyaki chicken recipe features a simple homemade marinade that infuses the chicken with aromatic flavor. It's the perfect weeknight meal when served with rice or noodles.

ingredients.item: 2 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Ham and Spinach Pie
recipes.description: With the exception of the phyllo dough, which I always have on hand, this ham and spinach pie recipe is made entirely from Easter dinner leftovers. One of my neighbors traded me four freshly caught trout for a slice!

ingredients.item: 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
2 cups finely chopped fully cooked ham
Optional: Salt and pepper to taste

recipes.title: Honey-Mustard Brussels Sprouts Salad
recipes.description: Even if you dislike Brussels sprouts, you will love this dish. The dressing is so tasty, and it pairs amazingly with the apples, grapes and walnuts. You can also add whatever cheese, nuts or fruit you prefer.

ingredients.item: 1 pound fresh Brussels sprouts, trimmed and shredded

recipes.title: Instant Pot Chili con Carne
recipes.description: Although multicookers can’t replace every tool in the kitchen, they sure are coming close. Chili con carne is one of our favorite dishes to re-create in them. This cooks up fast but tastes like it simmered all day!

ingredients.item: 1 can (16 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) Mexican diced tomatoes, undrained
Optional: Sour cream and sliced jalapeno

recipes.title: Italian Turkey Cutlets
recipes.description: "Because I'm watching my weight, I've used this recipe for years," writes Janet Bumb of Beallsville, Maryland. "Served with a flavorful tomato sauce, these cutlets taste so good that my son, who is thin and doesn't need to worry about his weight, requests them for his birthday dinner!"

ingredients.item: 2 teaspoons plus 1 tablespoon olive oil, divided
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) Italian stewed tomatoes, undrained
1 tablespoon minced fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil

recipes.title: Italian Vegetable Beef Soup
recipes.description: Ground meat, veggies and broth come together in a snap in this recipe for Italian vegetable beef soup, which can be customized endlessly to use whatever ingredients you've got.

recipes.title: Kabobless Chicken and Vegetables
recipes.description: As the primary caregiver for my grandma, I am trying to cook healthier for her. I am fascinated with Mediterranean cuisine. It is much easier to have chicken and vegetables off the kabob, which inspired this sheet-pan dinner.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipes.title: Kiwi-Strawberry Spinach Salad
recipes.description: This pretty strawberry kiwi salad is always a hit when I serve it! The recipe came from a cookbook, but I personalized it. Sometimes just a small change in ingredients can create a big difference.

recipes.title: Lemon Feta Chicken
recipes.description: Bright lemon juice and tangy feta cheese ensure every bite of this tender, juicy lemon feta chicken is packed with flavor.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)

recipes.title: Lemon-Parmesan Broiled Asparagus
recipes.description: These special spears are packed with flavor, thanks to the lemon-garlic dressing they're tossed in before roasting. It's a simple, quick side that goes with almost anything.

recipes.title: Lemon-Pepper Tilapia
recipes.description: Lemon-pepper tilapia is the kind of dish you can throw together on the spur of the moment. At just 20 minutes from start to finish, it's a great recipe to have in your repertoire.

recipes.title: Maple-Gingerroot Vegetables
recipes.description: My family loves this recipe because it brings out the lovely flavors of the vegetables. Even my children enjoy it

ingredients.item: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
1 large sweet onion, cut into wedges
1 small red onion, cut into wedges

recipes.title: Grilled Chicken Breasts
recipes.description: Learn how to grill chicken breast for the easiest summer dinner. The days of dull, dry chicken are over.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Muffin Tin Eggs
recipes.description: Muffin tin eggs are miniature baked omelets

ingredients.item: 1 jar (4 ounces) sliced mushrooms, finely chopped
3 ounces sliced deli ham, finely chopped

recipes.title: Naked Fish Tacos
recipes.description: This is one of my husband's all-time favorite meals. I've even converted some friends to fish after they've eaten this. I serve the dish with fresh melon when it's in season to balance the subtle heat of the cabbage mixture.

ingredients.item: 1/2 medium ripe avocado, peeled and sliced

recipes.title: Orange Shrimp Mojo
recipes.description: With jalapeno, orange and avocado, this enticing entree is spicy, tangy and fresh with every bite. The sauce beautifully glazes the shrimp.

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon grated orange or tangerine zest
1 pound uncooked jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 large navel orange, peeled, sectioned and chopped

recipes.title: Roasted Asparagus
recipes.description: This roasted asparagus recipe is made in a foil packet in the oven, keeping the spears bright and green with a consistently crisp texture.

recipes.title: Pan-Seared Salmon
recipes.description: Pan-seared salmon is an elegant, wholesome entree that requires little time or effort. Add a side salad or simple green, and dinner is served.

recipes.title: Pimiento Green Beans
recipes.description: Here's an easy way to turn everyday green beans into a special side dish. Pimientos, Parmesan cheese and chicken broth add savory flavor and a dash of color.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds fresh green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

recipes.title: Pineapple Smoothies
recipes.description: I found this recipe over 30 years ago. I've tried several diabetes-friendly recipes, and this is one of the best.

ingredients.item: 1 can (20 ounces) unsweetened pineapple chunks, undrained

recipes.title: Cabbage Stir-Fry
recipes.description: The ginger comes through nicely in this colorful pork and napa cabbage stir-fry. Serve it over steamed rice or cooked noodles for a cozy-savory meal.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup white wine or chicken broth
1 pound boneless pork loin, cut into 2-inch strips
1-1/2 pounds Chinese or napa cabbage, thinly sliced

recipes.title: Portobello Mushrooms Florentine
recipes.description: A fun and surprisingly hearty breakfast dish packed with flavor and richness.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup crumbled goat cheese or feta cheese

recipes.title: Pressure-Cooker Beef and Rice Cabbage Rolls
recipes.description: My family can't wait for dinner when I serve my tasty cabbage rolls. The dish comes together in a pinch and always satisfies.

recipes.title: Pressure-Cooker Mexican Beef Soup
recipes.description: My family loves this stew, and I'm happy to make it since it's so simple! Serve the dish with cornbread to make the meal even more filling.

ingredients.item: 3/4 pound potatoes (about 2 medium), cut into 3/4-inch cubes
1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes and green chiles
Optional: Sour cream and tortilla chips

recipes.title: Pressure Cooker Spice-Braised Pot Roast
recipes.description: Herbs and spices give the beef an excellent flavor. I often serve this roast over noodles or with mashed potatoes, using the juices as a gravy.

ingredients.item: 1 boneless beef chuck roast (2-1/2 pounds), halved

recipes.title: Quick Corn Salad
recipes.description: This sensational yet easy corn salad is a delight to serve because you can make it ahead, and it's an easy way to put garden bounty to good use. With colorful ingredients like corn, tomato and green pepper, it's also pretty in the bowl and on your plate.

ingredients.item: 2 cups fresh or frozen sweet corn

recipes.title: Radish Cucumber Salad
recipes.description: I put this cucumber radish salad together with vegetables I had left in my garden. My family liked it so much, I started taking it to community suppers and was often asked for the recipe. It's a refreshing accompaniment for any entree.

recipes.title: Roasted Apple Salad with Spicy Maple-Cider Vinaigrette
recipes.description: We bought loads of apples and needed to use them. To help the flavors come alive, I roasted the apples and tossed them with a sweet dressing.

ingredients.item: 4 medium Fuji, Gala or other firm apples, quartered
1 package (5 ounces) spring mix salad greens
1 log (4 ounces) fresh goat cheese, crumbled

recipes.title: Roasted Fall Vegetables
recipes.description: I love serving this tender veggie side dish as part of a comforting dinner on a chilly night. The cayenne pepper lends zippy flavor that's not overpowering.

ingredients.item: 1 large acorn squash, peeled and cut into 1-1/2-inch cubes
1 large rutabaga, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 medium pie pumpkin or butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
3 large carrots, peeled and cut into 1-1/2-inch pieces
1 medium parsnip, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes

recipes.title: Roasted Peppers and Cauliflower
recipes.description: Caramelization really enhances the flavors in this easy side dish. The seasoned, roasted peppers and cauliflower are just right with nearly any main course.

ingredients.item: 1 medium head cauliflower, broken into florets
2 medium sweet red peppers, cut into strips

recipes.title: Rosemary Walnuts
recipes.description: My Aunt Mary started making this recipe years ago. Each time we visited, she would have a batch ready for us. The use of cayenne adds an unexpected zing to the savory combo of rosemary and walnuts. When you need a good housewarming or hostess gift, double the batch and save half for yourself.

recipes.title: Salmon with Horseradish Pistachio Crust
recipes.description: Impress everyone at your table with this elegant but easy salmon that's delicious and nutritious. You can substitute scallions for shallots if you like.

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon snipped fresh dill or 1 teaspoon dill weed
1/2 teaspoon grated lemon or orange zest

recipes.title: Shrimp Avocado Salad
recipes.description: Shrimp avocado salad mixes tender shellfish with fresh vegetables for a cool, protein-filled lunch or easy light dinner.

ingredients.item: 1 pound peeled and deveined cooked shrimp, coarsely chopped
3 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Al Pastor Bowls
recipes.description: You'll love this easy version of a traditional Mexican favorite. Serve this al pastor bowl over rice or in tortillas with your favorite toppings.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (7 ounces each) whole green chiles
Optional toppings: Black beans, chopped avocado, corn, sliced radishes, lime and Mexican crema

recipes.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken
recipes.description: My chicken bundles are simple, clean and comforting. Serve them with wild rice and green beans for one of our favorite meals.

recipes.title: Spinach Salad with Warm Bacon Dressing
recipes.description: This spinach salad with warm bacon dressing proves that it's not difficult to get through an entire bag of spinach if it's dressed in a tangy, mustardy, brown-sugar bacon vinaigrette. Customize this classic salad with any toppings you like.

recipes.title: Strawberry-Blue Cheese Steak Salad
recipes.description: At lunch one day, a friend told me about a steak salad she'd had at a party. It sounded so fantastic I had to try it for myself. My family would eat it nonstop if we could. Can't seem to get enough of that tangy dressing!

ingredients.item: 1 beef top sirloin steak (3/4 inch thick and 1 pound)

recipes.title: Strawberry-Rhubarb Ice Pops
recipes.description: These cool, creamy pops are a deliciously different way to use up the bounty from your rhubarb patch.

ingredients.item: 3 cups chopped fresh or frozen rhubarb (1/2 inch)
8 freezer pop molds or 8 paper cups (3 ounces each) and wooden pop sticks

recipes.title: Zucchini and Summer Squash Side Dish
recipes.description: I’m trying to cut my risk for cardiac disease by changing the way I eat. This colorful sauteed zucchini and summer squash side dish is packed with as much nutrition as fresh-picked flavor!

ingredients.item: 1 medium yellow summer squash, quartered and sliced
1 medium sweet red pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipes.title: Sweet Orange Chicken
recipes.description: This orange chicken recipe with orange marmalade is a family favorite. It's sure to be a hit at your next get together!

ingredients.item: 1 broiler/fryer chicken (3 to 4 pounds), cut up and skin removed
Hot cooked rice or rice noodles, optional

recipes.title: Sweet Pea Pesto
recipes.description: I made a healthier spin on pea pesto by subbing in vegetable broth for some of the oil and going easy on the cheese. For use on pasta, add more broth for a saucelike consistency.

ingredients.item: 12 ounces fresh or frozen peas, thawed
1 whole wheat French bread demi-baguette (about 6 ounces and 12 in. long)
2 cups cherry tomatoes (about 10 ounces), halved or quartered

recipes.title: Tabbouleh
recipes.description: Take a break from green leaf salads, and enjoy a bright, lively tabbouleh salad. This parsley-and-bulgur salad tastes great on its own, and it pairs well with foods from Middle Eastern and Mediterranean cuisines.

recipes.title: Tangerine Tossed Salad
recipes.description: My mother taught me how to cook when I was a young girl. The sweet tangerines and crunchy caramelized almonds make this one of my favorite recipes.

recipes.title: Tangy Cilantro Lime Confetti Salad
recipes.description: I love standout salads that burst with flavor

ingredients.item: 2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed
1 cup fresh or frozen corn, thawed

recipes.title: Tangy Tender Pork Chops
recipes.description: I have used this recipe for many years and always get compliments when I serve it. The saucy onion-and-pepper topping compliments the chops.

ingredients.item: 6 bone-in pork loin chops (7 ounces each)
1 large green pepper, cut into rings

recipes.title: Flank Steak
recipes.description: With an overnight soy sauce marinade, a quick sear on a hot grill and the correct slicing technique (always against the grain), you can take a lean flank steak and make it oh-so-tender.

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Popcorn
recipes.description: Spicy Southwest seasoning makes this snackin'-good popcorn ideal for any fiesta.

recipes.title: Tomato Cucumber Mozzarella Salad
recipes.description: The fresher the ingredients, the tastier this tomato cucumber mozzarella salad will be. What's more, you can mix and match parts of this recipe to fit your preferences and use up what's already in your kitchen.

ingredients.item: 1 English cucumber, quartered and cut into 1/4-inch slices

recipes.title: Tomato-Melon Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Nothing says summer like picking watermelon, tomatoes and raspberries, then tossing them together in a salad. The addition of grilled chicken makes it a satisfying summery meal.

ingredients.item: 4 grilled chicken breasts (4 ounces each), sliced

recipes.title: Turkey in Cream Sauce
recipes.description: I've been relying on this recipe for tender turkey since I first moved out on my own years ago. I serve it whenever I invite new guests to the house, and I'm constantly writing out the recipe.

ingredients.item: 1-1/4 cups white wine or chicken broth
1/2 cup half-and-half cream or whole milk

recipes.title: Twisted Eggs Benedict Salad
recipes.description: Salad for breakfast? Absolutely. You can prep everything except the dressing and chill it overnight. In the morning, dress the salad and poach the eggs.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and chopped
8 ounces diced deli ham or Canadian bacon
6 cups baby kale salad blend (about 4 ounces)
1 cup chopped roasted sweet red peppers

recipes.title: Veggie Kabobs
recipes.description: Grilling is a delightful way of preparing the season's freshest produce. The zesty Italian marinade adds just the right amount of spice to these veggie kabobs.

recipes.title: Zucchini Panzanella Salad
recipes.description: I learned how to make panzanella from my friend's grandmother. Once I discovered how to make the perfect vinaigrette, it became a dish I crave during the summer. It's also a great way to use day-old bread and your garden's bounty of zucchini.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 cups heirloom mini or cherry tomatoes, halved

recipes.title: Bacon-Corn Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: Filled with corn, salsa, green onions, mozzarella cheese and bacon, these grilled pepper halves are sure to liven up your next cookout. They have a wonderful taste and give a fun twist to the usual corn on the cob.

ingredients.item: 1 medium green pepper, halved and seeded
1 medium sweet red pepper, halved and seeded

recipes.title: Oven-Fried Squash
recipes.description: Our oven-fried squash recipe is about as easy as they come. It's a crispy, crunchy way to use a bumper crop of summer squash.

ingredients.item: 4 cups thinly sliced yellow summer squash (3 medium)

recipes.title: Barley Corn Salad
recipes.description: A terrific alternative to pasta salad, this colorful side dish adds refreshing herb flavor to corn, barley, and red and green peppers. Bring it to your next get-together and see how fast it disappears!

recipes.title: Beans, Bacon & Tomato Bake
recipes.description: Bacon, tomatoes and lima beans combine for a nutrient-packed side dish that makes the perfect accompaniment to turkey.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained
8 cups frozen lima beans (about 42 ounces), thawed

recipes.title: Mexican-Style Pinto Beans
recipes.description: This Mexican-Style pinto beans recipe delivers rich, savory flavor and incredible versatility

ingredients.item: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) reduced-sodium chicken broth
2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) Mexican diced tomatoes, undrained

recipes.title: Carrots and Snow Peas
recipes.description: This is without question my favorite side dish, both for flavor and ease of preparation. Sherry adds an amazing spark to the vegetables.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Mash
recipes.description: This quick and easy mashed cauliflower is a wonderful alternative to same-old mashed spuds, and it's healthier, too!

recipes.title: Cilantro Ginger Carrots
recipes.description: Peppery-sweet ginger and cooling cilantro have starring roles in this colorful side of crisp-tender carrots. The veggie goes from pan to plate in a twinkling.

recipes.title: Cilantro Potatoes
recipes.description: Fresh cilantro gives an exotic Syrian-style flavor to these easy, delicious skillet potatoes. They’re a creative complement to Mom’s tangy kabobs.

recipes.title: Colcannon
recipes.description: Putting together your St. Patrick's Day feast? Make sure there's room for colcannon, one of Ireland's most famous potato dishes, on the table.

ingredients.item: 4 pounds medium potatoes (about 8), peeled and quartered

recipes.title: Confetti Quinoa
recipes.description: If you have never tried quinoa, start with my easy side, brimming with colorful veggies. I serve it with orange-glazed chicken.

recipes.title: Corn Okra Creole
recipes.description: This dish is representative of my area of the country, and particularly the Texas-Louisiana border. The okra, corn and Creole seasonings are all popular here.

ingredients.item: 2 cups fresh or frozen corn or 1 can (15-1/4 ounces) whole-kernel corn
1-1/2 cups sliced fresh or frozen okra
3 medium tomatoes, peeled and chopped (1-1/2 cups)

recipes.title: Cranberry Wild Rice Pilaf
recipes.description: This tender side dish is perfect for the holidays or any time you want to add a special touch. Dried cranberries, currants and almonds serve up color and texture. My co-workers all make this rice pilaf for their families.

recipes.title: Dutch Beets
recipes.description: Even people who typically shy away from beets will polish these off. This healthy canned vegetable recipe is quick to make, too, since you start with canned beets.

recipes.title: Quinoa Tabbouleh
recipes.description: We put a gluten-free twist on a classic Middle Eastern salad by using quinoa instead of bulgur. Our quinoa tabbouleh recipe features a protein-packed superfood, crisp veggies, fresh herbs and an easy lemon vinaigrette.

recipes.title: Eggplant Fries
recipes.description: My kids love this snack

recipes.title: Fiesta Corn and Beans
recipes.description: Bursting with southwestern flavors, the zesty veggie medley here can be served as a side dish or a meatless meal-in-one. The dollop of yogurt is a cool, creamy finishing touch.

ingredients.item: 1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 to 2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and sliced
2 cans (16 ounces each) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
Optional toppings: Plain yogurt and sliced ripe olives

recipes.title: Sauteed Cabbage
recipes.description: When I was young, my family grew our own cabbages. It was fun to put the cabbage to use in the kitchen, just as I did with this comforting side. With potatoes, deviled eggs and cornbread, fried cabbage tastes like home.

recipes.title: Garden-Fresh Rainbow Chard
recipes.description: Chard, a member of the beet family, is prized for its green leaves and colorful stalks. Stir up these good-for-you greens with garlic and red onion.

ingredients.item: 1 medium red onion, halved and sliced
2 bunches rainbow Swiss chard, coarsely chopped (about 16 cups)

recipes.title: Garlic Asiago Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description: The garlic seasoning and Asiago really pack a punch, making this five-ingredient low-carb side dish a real weeknight winner.

recipes.title: German Red Cabbage
recipes.description: This inexpensive red cabbage recipe makes a tender, tasty vegetable side dish. It's traditionally German, but it pairs well with all kinds of foods, in every season.

ingredients.item: 1 medium head red cabbage, shredded (about 8 cups)

recipes.title: Gouda Mixed Potato Mash
recipes.description: Everything's better with cheese, right? This cheesy two-potato mash is no exception. If you cube the cheese, you’ll discover delicious pockets of melted cheese throughout the dish.

ingredients.item: 6 medium Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cubed
2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed

recipes.title: Green Beans in Red Pepper Sauce
recipes.description: For easy veggies, I make a simple sauce of sweet red peppers, almonds and parsley. We also like this sauce with zucchini or roasted cauliflower.

recipes.title: Grilled Pattypans
recipes.description: Just a few minutes and a handful of ingredients are all you’ll need for this scrumptious side dish. Hoisin sauce and rice wine vinegar give grilled pattypans Asian flair.

recipes.title: Grilled Street Corn
recipes.description: Mexican food is my grandmother’s favorite. I wanted a perfect side for her legendary tacos, and this chile-lime grilled corn turned out to be just right.

recipes.title: Honey Garlic Green Beans
recipes.description: Green beans are a reliable standby, but they can seem ordinary on their own. Just a couple of extra ingredients give them a sweet and salty attitude. This is definitely my family's favorite way to enjoy them.

recipes.title: Honey-Thyme Butternut Squash
recipes.description: This golden, honey-sweetened squash is just as hearty and comforting as your favorite potato dish. With its bright color, it makes an attractive side for special autumn meals.

ingredients.item: 1 large butternut squash (about 5 pounds), peeled and cubed

recipes.title: Couscous and Broccoli
recipes.description: This stovetop couscous and broccoli recipe delivers bright, citrusy flavor without dirtying a single extra pot.

ingredients.item: 4 cups fresh broccoli florets, cut into small pieces

recipes.title: Lemon Parmesan Orzo
recipes.description: A splash of lemon and a shower of chopped parsley make this orzo one of my family's most requested springtime sides. It's fantastic with chicken, pork and fish, or you can eat it on its own as a light lunch.

ingredients.item: 1 cup uncooked whole wheat orzo pasta

recipes.title: Mashed Peppery Turnips
recipes.description: I created this recipe in an attempt to use up a great turnip harvest from our garden, and to lighten up one of our favorite dishes. By using turnips in place of potatoes, I made a low-carb side. Now we rarely serve plain mashed potatoes!

ingredients.item: 4 medium turnips (about 1 pound), peeled and cut into 1-1/4-in. pieces
1 large potato (about 3/4 pound), peeled and cut into 1-1/4-in. pieces

recipes.title: Marinated Steak & Pepper Fajitas

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup tequila or reduced-sodium beef broth
4 poblano or sweet red peppers, halved and seeded
1 large sweet onion, cut crosswise into 3/4-inch-thick slices
1-1/2 pounds beef skirt steaks or  flank steak

recipes.title: Meaty Slow-Cooked Jambalaya
recipes.description: This recipe makes a big batch of delicious, meaty gumbo. Stash some away in the freezer for days you don't feel like cooking.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup white wine or  additional reduced-sodium chicken broth
2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 package (12 ounces) fully cooked andouille or other spicy chicken sausage links
2 pounds uncooked shrimp (31-40 per pound), peeled and deveined

recipes.title: Mediterranean Turkey Skillet
recipes.description: Our one-pot Mediterranean turkey skillet recipe, filled with lean ground turkey, a rainbow of vegetables and savory black beans, is a weeknight winner.

ingredients.item: 2 medium zucchini, quartered lengthwise and cut into 1/2-inch slices
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained

recipes.title: Mocha Meringue Sandwich Cookies
recipes.description: These crisp, chewy cookies can be made any size you choose. They're also great with a variety of fillings

recipes.title: Molasses Crinkle Cookies
recipes.description: If you love desserts with warm and comforting spices, try these molasses crinkle cookies. They're crispy on the outside, chewy in the center and packed with irresistible flavors.

recipes.title: No-Bake Apple Pie
recipes.description: Forget the oven. This chilled, no-bake apple pie is served in a no-bake crust for the ultimate cool, sweet treat.

ingredients.item: 5 medium tart apples, peeled and sliced
1 package (3 ounces) cook-and-serve vanilla pudding mix

recipes.title: Old Bay Crispy Kale Chips
recipes.description: Here in East Hampton, NY, harvest time means big bunches of kale from local growers. These crunchy kale chips are delicious, super healthy and easy to make. I make them with seasoning to take the flavor up a notch. For extra zip, add a dash of cayenne pepper.

recipes.title: Cabbage Rolls
recipes.description: Call them old-fashioned, but these stuffed cabbage rolls are just as cozy and comforting as they've always been. Once you've got the hang of the rolling technique, you can stuff them with just about anything.

ingredients.item: 1/2 teaspoon snipped fresh dill or dill weed

recipes.title: Split Pea Soup
recipes.description: This split pea soup is hearty and soul-warming, just the thing for a cold day.

ingredients.item: 1 package (16 ounces) dried green split peas

recipes.title: Roasted Carrots and Onions
recipes.description: Season roasted carrots and onions with thyme, pepper and a splash of vinegar for a lovely, balanced vegetable side dish.

recipes.title: Sheet-Pan Chicken and Veggies
recipes.description: Our sheet-pan chicken and veggies recipe features herby chicken thighs, roasted red potatoes and spinach in one no-muss, no-fuss dish. The best part: Cleanup is a breeze!

ingredients.item: 2 pounds red potatoes (about 6 medium), cut into 3/4-inch pieces
1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary or 1 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
6 bone-in chicken thighs (about 2-1/4 pounds), skin removed

recipes.title: Parmesan Chicken with Artichoke Hearts
recipes.description: I've liked the chicken and artichoke combo for a long time. Here's my own lemony twist. With all the praise it gets, this dinner is so much fun to serve.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)
2 cans (14 ounces each) water-packed artichoke hearts, drained and quartered
1/2 cup white wine or reduced-sodium chicken broth

recipes.title: Peachy Jalapeno Guacamole
recipes.description: Fresh jalapenos and summer-ripe peaches give this creamy guacamole so much flavor. It's got a little kick, but I love that it's not so spicy it burns off my taste buds!

ingredients.item: 2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and cubed
1 medium peach, peeled and finely chopped

recipes.title: Peppered Tuna Kabobs
recipes.description: When we barbecue, we like to wow our guests, so dogs and burgers are out! We make tuna skewers topped with salsa

ingredients.item: 1 pound tuna steaks, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 large sweet red peppers, cut into 2x1-inch pieces
1 medium mango, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes

recipes.title: Pineapple Pudding Cake
recipes.description: Take a trip to the tropics with this creamy and refreshing pineapple pudding cake. Shortcuts like a boxed cake mix, instant pudding and whipped topping ensure this easy cake recipe comes together in no time at all.

ingredients.item: 1 package (3.4 ounces) instant vanilla pudding mix or 1 package (1 ounce) sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese or reduced-fat cream cheese
1 can (20 ounces) unsweetened crushed pineapple, well drained
1 carton (8 ounces) frozen  whipped topping or reduced-fat whipped topping, thawed

recipes.title: Pork Satay
recipes.description: This easy pork satay recipe combines savory, sweet and spiced flavors with a rich peanut sauce. Whether you’re hosting or craving something special, this dish is sure to impress.

ingredients.item: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into 1/4-inch slices

recipes.title: Pork Tenderloin Stew
recipes.description: This thick and creamy pork tenderloin stew is one that my family requests often. It does an especially good job of warming us up on cold winter days.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds pork tenderloin, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 pounds red potatoes, peeled and cubed
Optional: Chopped fresh parsley and cracked pepper

recipes.title: Pork with Sweet Potatoes
recipes.description: With sweet potatoes, dried cranberries and apple slices, this colorful pork dish is especially popular during fall and winter.

ingredients.item: 2 medium sweet potatoes (about 1 pound), peeled and cubed

recipes.title: Pulled Chicken Sandwich
recipes.description: This slow-cooker pulled chicken sandwich recipe delivers sweet and tangy goodness to folks who love Southern barbecue and also love easy cooking.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Oatmeal Muffins
recipes.description: These pumpkin oatmeal muffins aren't just healthy and virtuous. They're enough of a treat to enjoy for their own sweet sake, especially in pumpkin season.

ingredients.item: 1 large egg, room temperature, lightly beaten

recipes.title: Pumpkin Seed Cranberry Biscotti
recipes.description: Hints of pumpkin seed and almond give this biscotti recipe a wonderful flavor that's just right for fall. Try one with a cup of coffee or hot cocoa!

ingredients.item: 1 cup salted pumpkin seeds or pepitas, toasted

recipes.title: Easy Coq au Vin
recipes.description: Introduce French bistro vibes to your table with our easy coq au vin, a classic French stew you can whip up on a weeknight.

ingredients.item: 6 boneless skinless chicken thighs (4 ounces each)

recipes.title: Tuna Nicoise Salad
recipes.description: Tuna Nicoise salad is a perfect lunch for a weekend or even to make ahead for the work week. Our recipe is traditional with tuna, tomatoes and beans, but is easily adaptable to suit your tastes.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup oil and vinegar salad dressing
3 pouches (2-1/2 ounces each) light tuna in water

recipes.title: Beet Hummus
recipes.description: Break out of the plain hummus rut with this beet hummus recipe. Earthy, sweet beets are a vibrant, wholesome addition to the classic dip.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon plus 1/4 cup olive oil, divided
1 can (15 ounces) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained
Minced fresh dill weed or parsley

recipes.title: Red Pepper Tapenade
recipes.description: This roasted red pepper tapenade combines sweet red peppers, almonds and basil into a delicious spread that's perfect for entertaining or everyday snacking. Serve it with toasted baguette slices or water crackers.

ingredients.item: 2 cups roasted sweet red peppers, drained
Toasted French bread baguette slices or water crackers

recipes.title: Grilled Salmon in Foil
recipes.description: Grilled salmon in foil is one of the easiest, fastest ways to make dinner with hardly any mess! Salmon steams inside the foil packet, while tomatoes and onions soak up the curry powder used to season the salmon.

recipes.title: Salmon Veggie Packets
recipes.description: I feel the spirit of Julia Child when I make lemon-pepper salmon en papillote (in parchment). It’s the first French recipe I learned, and the delightful little packages are family-friendly.

ingredients.item: 2 cups fresh sugar snap peas, trimmed

recipes.title: Sassy Salsa Meat Loaves
recipes.description: Here's a twist on classic meat loaf. You can make these loaves ahead, and they’ll last for a few days. Make meat loaf sandwiches with the leftovers, buns and a little Monterey Jack cheese.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese or Mexican cheese blend

recipes.title: Saucy Pork Chop Skillet
recipes.description: Skillet pork chops make easy comfort food. We have them with a salad and fruit. If you've got fresh green beans or steamed broccoli, go for it.

ingredients.item: 6 boneless pork loin chops (6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Sausage Spinach Pasta Bake
recipes.description: Easier than a lasagna but just as satisfying, sausage spinach pasta bake is a comforting casserole loaded with a creamy tomato sausage ragù and the equivalent of a whole pound of raw spinach, all topped with gooey cheese.

ingredients.item: 1 package (16 ounces) whole wheat spiral pasta
1 pound Italian turkey sausage links, casings removed
1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipes.title: Seasoned Green Beans
recipes.description: A delicious meal is more than just an impressive main. Our seasoned green beans prove just how effective a knockout side dish can be, without taking more than 10 minutes to make.

recipes.title: Sesame Turkey Stir-Fry
recipes.description: I really like the rich taste of sesame oil in this Thai-inspired dish. If you don't have it, canola oil does the trick, too. To get a similar nuttiness, toss in a handful sliced almonds before serving.

ingredients.item: 1 small onion, cut into thin wedges
Thinly sliced serrano pepper and toasted sesame seeds, optional

recipes.title: Skillet Pork Chops with Apples & Onion
recipes.description: Pork chops with apples and onions is a timeless pairing; the combination of the simple ingredients yields a savory entree that's sweet, tart and perfectly saucy.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless pork loin chops (6 ounces each)
1 large onion, cut into thin wedges

recipes.title: Skinny Quinoa Veggie Dip
recipes.description: Don’t let the name fool you. This good-for-you recipe may appeal to an athlete in training, but it has plenty of flavor to satisfy everyone. We use crunchy cucumber slices for dippers.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and coarsely chopped
2 tablespoons plus 3/4 cup sour cream, divided
3/4 cup peeled, seeded and finely chopped cucumber

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Beef Bourguignon
recipes.description: Slow-cooker beef bourguignon simmers all day so you can enjoy a traditional French dinner tonight.

ingredients.item: Hot cooked whole wheat egg noodles, optional

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Butter Chicken
recipes.description: Creamy, tangy, tomatoey and mildly spiced slow-cooker butter chicken is a beloved Indian dish that's easy to recreate at home.

ingredients.item: 3 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
Optional: Fresh cilantro leaves and naan bread

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Pork Chops
recipes.description: It only takes a few simple ingredients to make these juicy and tender slow-cooker pork chops.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless pork loin chops (4 ounces each)

recipes.title: Slow-Cooker Split Pea Soup
recipes.description: Slow-cooker split pea soup is so easy, all you have to do is dump everything into the cooker. This soul-warming soup comes together in a snap!

ingredients.item: 1 package (16 ounces) dried green split peas, rinsed

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon New Potatoes
recipes.description: Give twice-baked potatoes a rest this year and try these stuffed spuds. Smoked salmon and cream cheese blended with lemon juice and dill are simply piped into small red potatoes. Leftovers are even good with eggs for breakfast.

ingredients.item: 36 baby red potatoes (1-1/2 inches wide, about 1-1/2 pounds)
1 package (8 ounces) reduced-fat cream cheese, cubed
2 packages (3 ounces each) smoked salmon or lox
2 tablespoons snipped fresh dill or 2 teaspoons dill weed

recipes.title: Socca
recipes.description: Socca is a traditional flatbread from Nice, France. It's a common street food, cooked on a grill and served in a paper cone, usually chopped and sprinkled with salt, pepper or other delicious toppings. Bonus: It's gluten free. — Taste of Home Test Kitchen, Milwaukee, Wisconsin

ingredients.item: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
Optional toppings: Za'atar seasoning, sea salt flakes, coarsely ground pepper and additional extra virgin olive oil

recipes.title: Soft Honey Cookies
recipes.description: These pillowy honey cookies pair perfectly with an afternoon cup of coffee or tea.

recipes.title: Sour Cream-Leek Biscuits
recipes.description: These biscuits are a wonderful pairing for soups. I've made them with all-purpose white flour as well as whole wheat, and both work equally well.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 cups finely chopped leeks (white portion only)

recipes.title: Southwest Egg Rolls
recipes.description: Moderately crispy with a rich and creamy filling, these semi-spicy appetizers taste like they’ve been fried.

ingredients.item: 2 tablespoons finely chopped sweet red pepper
1/4 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
3/4 cup shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese or reduced-fat Mexican cheese blend

recipes.title: Spicy Beef Stir Fry
recipes.description: Spice up your dinner rotation with our 30-minute beef stir fry recipe. Tender sirloin and crisp veggies meet a fiery coconut-lime sauce for a quick and delicious meal any night of the week.

ingredients.item: 1 pound beef top sirloin steak, cut into thin strips
1 large sweet red pepper, cut into thin strips
1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and thinly sliced

recipes.title: Andouille Sausage and Peppers
recipes.description: This tasty sheet pan meal is just what you need when the nights are busy and you have too much to do.<!-- notionvc: 39e9038e-e422-4a4e-b378-09e9a0c693c3 -->

ingredients.item: 1 pound potatoes (about 2 medium), peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 package (12 ounces) fully cooked andouille chicken sausage links or flavor of your choice, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium red onion, cut into wedges
1 medium sweet red pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipes.title: Spicy Shrimp Salsa
recipes.description: Radishes add a wonderful crunch to this colorful salsa that is also superb over grilled fish. There's just enough jalapeno to give flavor without much of the heat.

ingredients.item: 1/2 pound cooked shrimp, peeled, deveined and chopped
1-1/2 teaspoons finely chopped seeded jalapeno pepper

recipes.title: Turkey Meatballs
recipes.description: We make our turkey meatballs with spinach to ensure they turn out tender, juicy and moist. They freeze beautifully, so don’t be afraid to make a double (or triple) batch.

ingredients.item: 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

recipes.title: Steak San Marino
recipes.description: I'm a busy pastor's wife and mother of three,  and this delicious, inexpensive and easy main dish helps my day run smoother! The steak is so tender and flavorful, my kids gobble it up and my husband asks for seconds.

ingredients.item: 1 beef top round steak (1-1/2 pounds), cut into 6 pieces

recipes.title: Grilled Stuffed Zucchini
recipes.description: Grilled stuffed zucchini is filled with a light and savory blend of sauteed vegetables, breadcrumbs, melty cheese and fresh mint.

recipes.title: Succotash
recipes.description: This succotash recipe has everything that makes Southern cooking irresistible: ham hocks, beans, vegetables and herbs. It's easily customizable too, so you can add pretty much anything from your vegetable garden.

ingredients.item: 1 package (10 ounces) crowder peas, thawed, or 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) black-eyed peas, drained
1 cup sliced fresh or frozen okra
Optional: Snipped fresh dill and chives

recipes.title: Couscous Salad
recipes.description: This couscous salad recipe gets five stars from our reviewers! Create a versatile, summery salad that can be served as a potluck dish or a light lunch. Or, feel free to add chickpeas, grilled meat or seafood to make it filling enough to enjoy for dinner.

ingredients.item: 3 medium ears sweet corn, husks removed
1 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth

recipes.title: Sun-Dried Tomato Focaccia
recipes.description: This bread looks inviting and doesn’t disappoint when you take a bite. The sun-dried tomatoes and red onions give it an extra-special appearance, making it fit for any celebratory meal.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes (not packed in oil)
2 tablespoons slivered sun-dried tomatoes (not packed in oil)

recipes.title: Pork Roast
recipes.description: A simple herb rub and a brown sugar crust create a tender, flavorful pork roast. Serve with pan juices and your favorite sides for a family meal everyone loves.

ingredients.item: 1 boneless pork loin roast (3 to 4 pounds)

recipes.title: Sunflower Seed & Honey Wheat Bread
recipes.description: I've tried other bread recipes, but this one is a staple in our home. I won $50 in a bake-off with a loaf that I had stored in the freezer.

ingredients.item: 2 packages (1/4 ounce each) active dry yeast

recipes.title: Sweet & Tangy Salmon with Green Beans
recipes.description: I'm always up for new ways to cook salmon. In this dish, a sweet sauce gives the fish and green beans some down-home barbecue tang. Even our kids love it.

recipes.title: Tangy Texas Salsa
recipes.description: I'm a "transplant" from Wisconsin currently living in Texas. Even after 20 years, I can't get enough of our wonderful local citrus. This is one way to work it into a main dish. The combination of tangy fruit, spicy jalapeno and distinctive cilantro is perfect over any meat, poultry or fish. We also dip into it with chips.

recipes.title: Tomato Focaccia
recipes.description: Tomato focaccia bread is a fantastic side for all sorts of dishes, such as roasted chicken, pork chops, sea bass, and more. It's also fantastic on its own or topped with a fried egg.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon each dried oregano, thyme and rosemary, crushed

recipes.title: Lamb Stew
recipes.description: Tender chunks of lamb come together with carrots and potatoes in this rich, hearty lamb stew recipe. Serve it as a one-pot meal with crusty bread, or double down on comfort by ladling the stew over polenta or mashed potatoes.

recipes.title: Cabbage Stew
recipes.description: Chock-full of ground turkey, cabbage, carrots and tomatoes, this turkey cabbage soup delivers delicious down-home comfort on cool days.

recipes.title: Ground Turkey Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: These ground turkey stuffed peppers are a nice change of pace from traditional ground beef and rice peppers. Lean ground turkey gives the peppers a light feel without sacrificing flavor.

ingredients.item: 5 medium green, red or yellow peppers
1-3/4 cups shredded cheddar-flavored lactose-free or other cheese

recipes.title: Chicken Tzatziki
recipes.description: Chicken tzatziki is the perfect weeknight dinner, a great staple that's easy to prepare but full of flavor. The creamy cucumber sauce goes with just about anything!

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 cups finely chopped peeled English cucumber
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)

recipes.title: Meringue Cookies
recipes.description: These sweet little swirls are light as can be. They're all you need after a big, special dinner.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 teaspoons clear or regular vanilla extract

recipes.title: Vegetable & Beef Stuffed Red Peppers
recipes.description: I love making this stuffed pepper recipe. It's one of the few ways I can get my husband to eat veggies. Make it meatless by replacing the beef with eggplant and adding more vegetables like mushrooms or squash. You can also replace the rice with barley, couscous or even orzo.

ingredients.item: 1 cup ready-to-serve long grain and wild rice

recipes.title: Vegetable Samosas
recipes.description: My family enjoys the wonderful Indian flavors in a traditional samosa. Baked instead of fried, this version has fewer calories but keeps all the classic tastes and textures we love.

ingredients.item: 1 cup canned garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed, drained and mashed
1 package (16 ounces, 14x9-inch sheet size) frozen phyllo dough, thawed

recipes.title: West African Peanut Stew
recipes.description: Even if you don't have the most adventurous palate, West African peanut stew is a dish almost anyone can appreciate. It's a rich, comforting meal for cooler weather, and the ingredients are both familiar and widely available.

ingredients.item: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 cans (15-1/2 ounces each) black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained
1 large sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1-1/2 teaspoons minced fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, divided

recipes.title: Wild Rice Bread with Sunflower Seeds
recipes.description: I loved skipping the boring school cafeteria meals and going to my grandma’s house for lunch. She spent most of her life in northeastern Minnesota, which is reflected in this bread's ingredients. Now my family uses this for our holiday stuffing.

ingredients.item: 2 packages (1/4 ounce each) active dry yeast
1 package (8.8 ounces) ready-to-serve long grain and wild rice
1 cup plus 1 tablespoon unsalted sunflower kernels, divided

recipes.title: Yogurt Cornbread
recipes.description: My husband doesn't like traditional Texas cornbread, so I came up with this recipe. This is the only kind he'll eat. Yogurt makes this variation different from most.

ingredients.item: 1 large egg, lightly beaten, room temperature

recipes.title: Yogurt & Honey Fruit Cups
recipes.description: A tasty combo of fresh fruit and creamy orange-kissed yogurt, this is guaranteed to disappear fast from your breakfast table.

ingredients.item: 4-1/2 cups cut-up fresh fruit (pears, apples, bananas, grapes, etc.)
3/4 cup mandarin orange, vanilla or lemon yogurt

recipes.title: Yogurt Pancakes
recipes.description: Our yogurt pancakes have a special ingredient that makes them extra fluffy. That's right; it's the yogurt, and it reacts with other ingredients to create pancakes that are unusually light and airy, just the way you like them.

ingredients.item: 2 large eggs, room temperature, lightly beaten
Optional: Semisweet chocolate chips, dried cranberries, sliced ripe bananas and coarsely chopped pecans

recipes.title: Zippy Shrimp Skewers
recipes.description: These flavorful skewers deliver a mouthwatering kick with minimal effort. Fix them for your next party and watch them disappear.

ingredients.item: 3/4 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipes.title: Zucchini Ricotta Bake
recipes.description: Layered like lasagna, packed with veggies and dripping in ricotta, this zucchini ricotta bake is comfort food with a green thumb.

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Chicken Breasts
recipes.description: These air-fryer chicken breasts are perfectly cooked with a simple seasoning blend of pantry herbs and spices. File this recipe away for quick dinners and easy meal prep.

recipes.title: Alabama Chicken Stew
recipes.description: North Alabama chicken stew is a regional labor of love full of flavor that comes across in every bite. Make a giant batch to share at large gatherings like potlucks, fundraisers and family get-togethers.

ingredients.item: 1 (4 pounds) whole chicken, neck and gizzards removed
3 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-in. chunks

recipes.title: Alex Bala’s One-Pot Short Rib Stroganoff
recipes.description: If you’ve ever made pot roast, you can make short ribs because beef is beef! The rich short ribs simmer low and slow until they're fall-apart tender. Toss in buttery noodles, savory mushrooms and a splash of cream to create a velvety stroganoff sauce, and you’ve got the ultimate comfort meal, all in one pot.

ingredients.item: 3/4 cup heavy whipping cream, room temperature
Optional: Minced fresh parsley, chives or grated Parmesan cheese

recipes.title: Alfredo Meatballs
recipes.description: These Alfredo meatballs are baked in the oven, then smothered in a velvety homemade sauce. Serve them over hot pasta for a comforting family-friendly dinner.

ingredients.item: Optional: hot cooked pasta and minced fresh parsley

recipes.title: Pork Chops and Applesauce
recipes.description: If you love the lean, tender texture of pork chops but wish they had more flavor to offer, this recipe for pork chops and applesauce solves the conundrum. You can pretty much let the oven do the work too.

ingredients.item: 4 bone-in pork loin chops (1/2 inch thick and 7 ounces each)

recipes.title: Asian Lettuce Wraps
recipes.description: This recipe is as tasty as the lettuce wraps found in national restaurants, but it's healthier!

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon sugar or sugar substitute blend equivalent to 1 tablespoon sugar

recipes.title: Bacon Cheeseburger Pizza
recipes.description: For the nights you crave a burger and a slice at the same time, bacon cheeseburger pizza is your ticket to happiness.

recipes.title: Bacon Cheeseburger Tater Tot Bake
recipes.description: Huge on flavor and not too big in terms of hand-on effort, this bacon cheeseburger tater tot casserole is a meal the chef and the diners alike will always agree on.

recipes.title: Chicken Bacon Swiss Sandwich
recipes.description: This chicken bacon Swiss sandwich recipe combines juicy, boldly flavored chicken breast with smoky, crumbled bacon and a delicious honey mustard sauce to create the perfect bite.

ingredients.item: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)
Lettuce leaves and tomato slices, optional

recipes.title: Baked Chicken Legs
recipes.description: These baked chicken legs are crispy on the outside, juicy inside and packed with flavor thanks to a simple blend of pantry spices.

recipes.title: Barbecue Chicken Quesadilla
recipes.description: You and your family will love these barbecue chicken quesadillas, a perfectly quick and easy weeknight dinner that's so tasty you'd pay for it at a restaurant.

ingredients.item: Optional: Sour cream and additional salsa

recipes.title: Pulled Pork Pasta
recipes.description: When you don't have hours to whip up a slow-cooked meal, this hearty pulled pork pasta recipe is a great shortcut. It tastes as if it cooked all day but can be ready in just 25 minutes.

ingredients.item: 1 carton (16 ounces) refrigerated fully cooked barbecued shredded pork
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes with mild green chiles, undrained

recipes.title: Mini Barbecue Meat Loaves
recipes.description: Cheesy, tangy, and super juicy, these mini loaves are a total treat.

ingredients.item: Additional hickory smoke-flavored barbecue sauce, optional

recipes.title: Bean & Bacon Griddle Burritos
recipes.description: These griddle burritos with bacon and veggies make an awesome hand-held meal. I use fresh pico de gallo when I can, but a jar of salsa works if that’s what you’ve got.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup crumbled Cotija cheese or  shredded Monterey Jack cheese
3 bacon strips, cooked and coarsely chopped

recipes.title: Beanie Weenies
recipes.description: This old-fashioned meal is a New England classic. Beanie weenies are sweet and savory, and best served with a side of molasses-flavored brown bread.

ingredients.item: 1 can (28 ounces) maple and bacon-flavored baked beans

recipes.title: Beef Manhattan
recipes.description: If you've never heard of beef Manhattan, you're about to meet the open-faced sandwich of your dreams. This slow-cooker recipe layers mashed potatoes and juicy roast beef over Texas toast.

recipes.title: Potato Soup
recipes.description: This easy homemade potato soup recipe is a staple side for steak dinners at home or an amazing comfort meal on a chilly day.

recipes.title: Best Lasagna
recipes.description: What makes this classic lasagna recipe so spectacular? Homemade meat sauce and plenty of cheese. Best of all, it's easy to make lasagna ahead of time so dinner can be ready in a flash.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (one 28 ounces, one 15 ounces) crushed tomatoes
3 tablespoons plus 1/4 cup minced fresh parsley, divided

recipes.title: Bison Meat Loaf
recipes.description: Bison meat loaf made with lean bison, herbs and a dash of Big Sky Country isn't just better for you

recipes.title: Blackened Catfish with Mango Avocado Salsa
recipes.description: A delightful and tasty rub makes this quick recipe fantastic. While the fish is sitting to allow the flavors to blend, you can easily assemble the salsa. My family loves this!

ingredients.item: 1 medium ripe avocado, peeled and cubed

recipes.title: Blackened Fish Tacos
recipes.description: Blackened fish tacos take taco night to new heights with spiced pan-fried cod, a cooling cilantro crema and soft tortillas.

ingredients.item: 8 each corn or flour tortillas (6 inches)

recipes.title: BLT Pizza
recipes.description: This recipe takes everything you love about BLT sandwiches and turns it into pizza. We promise, BLT pizza will become a favorite pick for lunch, dinner or an anytime snack.

recipes.title: BLTs
recipes.description: It sneaks up every year, but when the farmers market glows with bright red tomatoes or sunny orange and yellow heirloom varieties, there’s no denying that it’s finally BLT season.

recipes.title: Bow Ties with Gorgonzola Sauce
recipes.description: The name may sound fancy, but this pasta dish is comforting and simple to prepare. Add a mixed green salad to make it a complete meal for any occasion.

recipes.title: Brazilian Chicken Stroganoff
recipes.description: Brazilian chicken stroganoff is a fun twist on a classic that's beloved by Matthew McConaughey and Camila Alves, his Brazilian wife. It's a more heavily seasoned take on Russian stroganoff.

ingredients.item: 2 teaspoons Goya Sazon with coriander and annatto
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cubed
Potato sticks or crushed potato chips, optional

recipes.title: Broccoli Cheddar Pasta

Some say it was initially served in a bottle depicting a monkey with a long tail, but others suggest it was named after a funny incident with a Chilean president in the early 1900s. Whatever the origin, coffee and spirits will make this sweet chilled drink warm you right up this Christmas. It also goes by "cola de mono."

recipes.title: Cumin-Spiced Lentil Burgers
recipes.description: I adapted my Turkish daughter-in-law’s traditional recipe for lentil logs

recipes.title: Dirty Martini Dip

A smooth blend of ripe avocado, cream cheese and fresh lime juice is whipped to perfection, then piped into crisp golden phyllo shells for a light, buttery base. Each tartlet is crowned with a juicy Cajun seasoning-dusted shrimp, then finished with a spoonful of pico de gallo and a sprinkle of cilantro. It’s rich, zesty and irresistibly flavorful. These are perfect for summer soirées or an elevated appetizer spread!

I make them with tender slices of NY strip steak and sauteed bell peppers, onions and mushrooms, all tucked into roasted zucchini halves and topped with melted provolone. It's a healthy twist on the sandwich we know and love, without sacrificing flavor. This dish is hearty, satisfying and weeknight-friendly.

recipes.description: This authentic falafel recipe uses dried beans that are simply soaked

Top these beauties with a sweet and savory maple tahini sauce. You can serve them sandwich-style, as an appetizer over a bed of greens, or with soup and salad.

recipes.title: Feta Bruschetta
recipes.description: Fun to say and tasty to eat, feta bruschetta is an easy, flavor-packed appetizer with herbs, spices and tangy cheese in every toasted bite.

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon minced fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil

recipes.title: Feta-Stuffed Kibbeh with Harissa
recipes.description: There are countless versions of this delicious dish throughout the Middle East. This is our adaptation. You can substitute ground beef for the lamb.

recipes.title: Salsa Criolla
recipes.description: If salsa criolla sounds exotic, your ears are not deceiving you. It’s an essential Peruvian salsa that brings acidity and sweetness to sandwiches, meat dishes, potatoes and even eggs. But it’s not for Peruvian cuisine only. Try it on your regular weeknight meals for a little variety.

2 medium sweet orange or yellow peppers, very thinly sliced

recipes.title: Godfather Cocktail
recipes.description: If you love Scotch, you need to try a classic Godfather cocktail.

recipes.title: Green Shakshuka

recipes.title: Chocolate-Hazelnut Babka Buns

recipes.title: Herbed Pumpkin Flatbread

recipes.title: Herby Chicken with Apricots and Feta

recipes.title: Hetal Vasavada’s Iced Chai
recipes.description:
I grew up watching my Ba (grandmother) brew chai every single day, adjusting the spices by instinct and never measuring a thing. This iced chai is my simpler summer version of her classic recipe, using strong CTC tea, crushed cardamom and cinnamon. CTC tea stands for Crush, Tear, Curl, a method that turns black tea leaves into tiny granules of tea. It brews quickly and delivers a strong, tannic flavor that’s the backbone of authentic Indian chai. Leave your expensive whole tea leaves for another day: If you’re making chai, you have to use CTC tea. Lipton's black tea is a good option.

To make this chai as traditional as possible, I prefer a higher ratio of milk to water. It creates a richer chai with tons of body. Unlike the weak, sugary chai you’ll find at many cafes, this one is bold, creamy and deeply spiced

ingredients.item: 1 tablespoon or 1 bag CTC black tea
Sweetener of your choice (sugar, stevia, agave)

recipes.title: Hetal Vasavada’s Matchai Tiramisu
recipes.description: This matcha and chai (matchai!) tiramisu blends the earthy bitterness of matcha with the warm, spiced comfort of chai. The tiramisu is layered into coupe glasses, so it’s the perfect no-bake dessert that feels fancy but comes together without a fuss.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon matcha (green tea powder), plus additional for garnish

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Churros
recipes.description: Our air-fryer churro recipe is made for those wanting the sweet treat without all the oil or messy cleanup. Skip the frying!

recipes.title: Homemade Chili Crisp

12 ounces salmon or trout fillets, bones and skin removed, cubed

recipes.title: Homemade Gelt
recipes.description: Skip the grocery store gelt! Instead try this quick and easy homemade gelt that will wow all of your Hanukkah guests.

ingredients.item: 3 (3-1/2 ounces each) dark chocolate candy bars, melted

recipes.title: Hot Apricot Chai Cocktail

It's a citrusy, spicy, and mouthwatering pork roast more flavorful than anything you've ever had. Cooking and eating this should remind you of the best parts of island life. It's OK to use fresh-squeezed orange juice, lime juice, or a combination of both instead of grapefruit juice. But please, don't ever make this with bottled juice.

1 serrano pepper, seeded and chopped, optional
1 boneless pork shoulder roast (4 to 5 pounds)

recipes.title: Jamaican Cabbage and Saltfish

It may take a few extra hours in the kitchen, but the end result is always delectable. Instead of the beef broth, you can add hot water and slowly cook the oxtails. To deglaze your pot after searing the meat you can opt to use a quarter cup of red wine.

recipes.title: Mandel Bread

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Ube Bread

recipes.title: Lucy Wang’s Zongzi
recipes.description: This traditional Chinese dish ties back to a true story of a beloved poet named Qu Yuan who was wrongfully accused of treason. People commemorate him each year on the fifth day of the fifth month on the Lunar calendar (usually toward the end of May or June), with dragon boat festivities and these bamboo leaves stuffed with sticky rice and pork belly. Cook a ton of these in advance and keep them in a zip-top bag in the freezer. Thaw them in the fridge overnight and microwave for two minutes in the leaves, or boil them for 10 to 15 minutes directly from the freezer. You can get the leaves on Amazon. Everything else can be found at a local Asian market like HMart.

If you want to prep them in advance, make the balls but don’t boil them just yet! Sprinkle a little glutinous rice flour on them and freeze them in an airtight container. Boil them right before you plan to serve them.
